title: Is it legal to use someone's image as album art without their knowledge? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: This is like asking “is it legal to download a book without the author knowing about it?” What determines the legality isn’t whether or not the owner knows that you’ve done it, but whether the material is properly licensed. So, for example, if by “someone’s image”, you mean “an image someone owns”, and they have granted the right to license use of the image to someone else (e.g., they’re making it available via a stock art site), and you have licensed it through that third party, then yes, it would be perfectly legal to do so, even though they don’t know that you’re doing it. From a legal perspective, what matters is that you have properly licensed the image. It doesn’t matter whether or not the owner of the image personally knows that you have done so. The same applies if you mean “an image of someone”. If you have properly licensed the right to use the image, it doesn’t matter whether or not the person appearing in that image knows. Similar to the above, if you license an image of someone from a stock art site, and the owner of the image obtained the proper model release from that person, then it doesn’t matter whether or not that person knows you are using their image.

I don’t really understand why people ask Quora questions about legal matters. We can tell you what we think, but clearly, we’re not attorneys, so you’d better not rely on anything anyone here tells you. Anyway, my best opinion is this: if there is any profit to be made from our images, then we are each entitled to it. At least I believe that is the legal principle involved. So if you do not get an agreement about the use of someone’s image, then the image-holder can sue you for a portion of the profits - and possible damages for invasion of their privacy. I know I would. Thanks Benjamin, for the compliment of the A2A.
